pros: Learned how to communicate with college students regarding assignment duties
cons: Not any cons, learned a lot and meet new faces that are enrolled and working at SUNY Cortland

job_title: Senior Instructional Designer in Cortland, NY
pros: It's a large school with deep resources and links to the 62 other schools in the SUNY System. SUNY Online is a wonderful resource with an annual conference and a lot of talented people. The union is strong and very worth supporting. Housing is cheap in the area.
cons: Despite a high enrollment, SUNY Cortland often has financial shortfalls. It is a party school and attracts students from all around the area for that purpose. The local area is depressed, so politics at the school can be cut-throat as people desperately want to keep their union jobs.

pros: It's a big school and has access to the resources of the 60+ other schools in the SUNY system. It is a union school, so there is excellent protection for positions. It has strong Library holdings if you are a researcher, and housing in the area is inexpensive. Lots of lovely waterfalls and hiking trails in the area.
cons: All employees are state employees, and must therefore follow NY state rules, which can be restrictive. Everyone is deeply protective of their position, so change is difficult. It is known as a party school so student misbehavior is common. The best students are the same as everywhere else. Cortland is post-industrial and has issues with underemployment and all goes with that (drugs, crime).

pros: Good people and fun environment
cons: Some wonky hours for sure

pros:
Some benefits to being a personal trainer at SUNY Cortland are

1) Great pace to get personal training experience as  novice personal trainer.

2) Access to a diverse group of clientele: young adults - elderly.

3) Staff is friendly and supportive

4) Supervisors are supportive and care about how you are doing as a trainer and as a person.
cons: The only con I'll give to being a personal trainer at SUNY Cortland will be the wages.

review_title: Great place to work but some internal issues

pros: Great place to work! Wonderful sense of community and welcoming environment. Overall really good people to work with. Students are great to work with.
cons: Biased department politics.  Unethical search committee practices. Lack of institutional accountability and support for documented and valid grievances.
